metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0705 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the dsa_priv_decode function incrypto/dsa/dsa_ameth.c in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1s and 1.0.2 before1.0.2g allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed DSAprivate key.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18').
